subject: Parenting
title: What History Teaches Us
description: A short lesson to help you apply What History Teaches Us.

hook.text: Every generation of parents believes they've finally figured it out. History says otherwise.

buildup.text: From Sparta to helicopter parenting, every era was confident its approach was correct.

discovery.text: The constants across all eras and cultures: children need safety, connection, and appropriate challenge.

twist.text: The methods change endlessly. The core needs never do. Warmth and structure appear in every successful model.

climax.text: Today's 'best practices' will be tomorrow's outdated advice. Humility is the wisest parenting stance.

quiz.question: What parenting constants appear across all eras and cultures?
